--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2021/0508 b) Date of Occurrence: 20/09/2023
c) Installation Details: Wasp Interceptor - AC-2735-271 at
Sector South Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 27/09/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Compressor Section d) Main Assembly: Station-4 Port
e) Nomenclature: Compressor Section Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-C
g) Part No.: PR-5936-V9 h) Sl No.: SN-9059-488
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 15/10/2023 l) Date of Removal: 25/09/2023
Pg No: 112 Ln No: 23 Pg No: 1 Ln No: 7
m) Manufacturing Agency: Zeta Systems Corp n) Date, Month & Year September 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 730 Hrs / 1178 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Environmental exposure causing accelerated degradation of protective coatings
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Compressor Section component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 04/10/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 07/10/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational usage reviewed. Component operated within prescribed limits. Concur with investigation outcome.
Date: 08/10/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 09/10/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 14/10/2023 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
